Easy Diabetic Banana Bread Recipe

If you're a diabetic or have someone in your life who is, finding delicious and healthy recipes can sometimes be a challenge. But fear not, because today I'm going to share with you an easy diabetic banana bread recipe that is sure to satisfy your sweet tooth without causing a spike in your blood sugar levels.

First, let's gather the ingredients. You'll need 2 ripe bananas, 1/4 cup of unsweetened applesauce, 1/4 cup of honey or a sugar substitute of your choice, 1/4 cup of low-fat milk, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 1 cup of whole wheat flour, 1/2 cup of almond flour, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda, 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon, and a pinch of salt.

To start, preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and lightly grease a loaf pan. In a mixing bowl, mash the bananas until smooth. Add in the applesauce, honey (or sugar substitute), milk, and vanilla extract. Mix well until all the ingredients are combined.

In a separate bowl, whisk together the whole wheat flour, almond flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. Slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, stirring until just combined. Be careful not to overmix, as this can result in a dense and tough bread.

Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top with a spatula. Bake for about 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

This diabetic banana bread is not only easy to make, but it's also packed with fiber and nutrients from the whole wheat flour and bananas. It's a guilt-free treat that you can enjoy any time of the day. So go ahead and give this recipe a try, and let me know how it turns out for you!
